intro: Panax americanus, commonly known as American ginseng, is a perennial herb native to the northeastern United States and eastern Canada. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive fleshy, yellowish root system. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters, featuring feather-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that develop into red berries. Its roots are highly valued in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Botanically, it is distinguished by its complex chemical composition, including ginsenosides, which contribute to its medicinal properties.
